byline.original: By Densie Webb; Densie Webb, a freelance writer and editor, is a registered dietitian

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MOST people's diets fall far short of the ideal set by organizations like the National Academy of Sciences, the National Cancer Institute and the American Heart Association: cutting back on fat, eating more fiber, reducing cholesterol, eating more fruits, vegetables and whole-grain foods.
docs.snippet: LEAD: MOST people's diets fall far short of the ideal set by organizations like the National Academy of Sciences, the National Cancer Institute and the American Heart Association: cutting back on fat, eating more fiber, reducing cholesterol, eating...

headline.main: HEALTH RISKS SEEN IN BLOOD PRESSURE JUST ABOVE NORMAL

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Above-normal blood pressure, even if it is not high enough to qualify as hypertension, can permanently damage heart and blood vessels and increase the risk of heart attack, a new study says.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Above-normal blood pressure, even if it is not high enough to qualify as hypertension, can permanently damage heart and blood vessels and increase the risk of heart attack, a new study says.

headline.main: Childhood Abuse Tied to Ill Health in Women

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WOMEN who were abused as children have more health problems and require more hospital care than women who were not abused, researchers have found.
docs.snippet: LEAD: WOMEN who were abused as children have more health problems and require more hospital care than women who were not abused, researchers have found.
